Overview¶

Project Name: Data Acquisition Base Application

Objective: The Data Acquisition Base Application aims to provide a robust foundation for acquiring raw data from various sources, specifically focusing on CSV-formatted files. The project will evolve through different phases, starting with data extraction and restructuring, followed by data cleaning and validation in subsequent iterations.

Who: - Analysts and Decision-Makers: Require a reliable tool to gather and preprocess data for in-depth analysis. - Developers: Need a flexible and extensible framework for acquiring data from diverse sources.

What: - Develop a command-line application (CLI) capable of extracting relevant data from CSV files. - Restructure raw data into a more usable form for downstream analysis.

When: - Initial Phase (Current): Focus on data acquisition and restructuring. - Subsequent Phases: Integrate features for data cleaning and validation.

Where: - The application runs from the command line, providing flexibility for manual, automated, or web service-based execution. - The project’s source code is hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/thapelomagqazana/data_analysis_pipeline).

Why: - Flexibility: Adapt to changing data sources without assumptions about formats. - Automation: Enable automation through CLI execution or integration into enterprise job scheduling applications. - Extensibility: Reflect and adapt to changes in data sources over time.

Definition of Done¶

  1. CSV Data Extraction: - The application effectively extracts relevant data from CSV-formatted files.

  2. Restructuring: - Raw data is restructured into a more usable format for downstream analysis.

  3. Flexibility: - The application is flexible in accommodating changes in data sources without hardcoded assumptions.

  4. CLI Automation: - The CLI application can be manually run, automated, or integrated into other systems.

  5. Extensibility: - The codebase allows for seamless extension to accommodate changes in data sources.

  6. Documentation: - Comprehensive documentation covering usage, architecture, and design decisions.

  7. Testing: - Unit tests and acceptance tests ensure the reliability and correctness of the application.

  8. Version Control: - Source code is version-controlled using Git, hosted on a public repository.

  9. Adherence to Design Principles: - The application follows object-oriented design, SOLID principles, and functional design where appropriate.

  10. Collaboration: - Collaboration tools such as Git and GitHub are used effectively for version control and issue tracking.

This project’s success will be measured by its ability to provide a reliable and adaptable foundation for data acquisition, setting the stage for subsequent phases of data processing and analysis.
